DataElement.preferredName: National Cancer Institute Cancer Centers Program Patient Rural Address Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient address is rural according to NCI Cancer Centers Program (NCCCP) criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: National Cancer Institute Cancer Centers Program Patient Rural Address
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The NCI Cancer Centers Program comprises more than 50 NCI-designated cancer centers engaged in multidisciplinary research to reduce cancer incidence, morbidity and mortality. Through Cancer Center Support grants, this program supports three types of centers: Comprehensive Cancer Centers, Clinical Cancer Centers, and Cancer Centers. It was the National Cancer Act of 1971 that strengthened the program by authorizing the establishment of 15 new cancer centers and the continued support for existing ones._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Of or pertaining to the country as opposed to the city. (American Heritage Dictionary)_The location at which an organization or person can be reached. (from American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.longName: National Cancer Institute Cancer Centers Program
Concepts.definition: The NCI Cancer Centers Program comprises more than 50 NCI-designated cancer centers engaged in multidisciplinary research to reduce cancer incidence, morbidity and mortality. Through Cancer Center Support grants, this program supports three types of centers: Comprehensive Cancer Centers, Clinical Cancer Centers, and Cancer Centers. It was the National Cancer Act of 1971 that strengthened the program by authorizing the establishment of 15 new cancer centers and the continued support for existing ones.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the country as opposed to the city. (American Heritage Dictionary):The location at which an organization or person can be reached. (from American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the country as opposed to the city. (American Heritage Dictionary)
A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
